title: RL31625
content: Title VI of the Higher Education Act authorizes grants to institutions for enhancing foreign language and area studies. The program has a long history of supporting courses in less commonly taught languages and regions, reflecting federal government's priority on diplomacy and national security. The federal government prioritizes Foreign Language and Area Studies (FLAS) programs for diplomacy, national security, and trade competitiveness. Interest in FLAS has grown due to concerns about terrorism from regions not commonly included in American curricula. Title VI programs may be up for reauthorization by Congress, with appropriations remaining at $93.1 million in FY2007 and $95.6 million in FY2008. This report provides an overview of Title VI programs and reauthorization issues. The Higher Education Amendments of 1998 authorized Title VI programs at "such sums as necessary" through December 31, 2005.
